com.github.valid8j.pcond.validator

Interface Validator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Validator.Impl

    public interface Validator

    An interface of a policy for behaviours on 'contract violations'.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • configuration

        Validator.Configuration configuration()

        Returns a configuration object that determines behaviors of this object.

        Returns:
        A configuration object.

      • create

        static Validator create(Properties properties)

        Returns a provider instance created from a given Properties object. This method reads the value for the FQCN of this class (com.github.valid8j.pcond.provider.AssertionProvider) and creates an instance of a class specified by the value. If the value is not set, this value instantiates an object of DefaultAssertionProvider and returns it.

        Parameters:
        properties - A Properties object from which an AssertionProvider is created
        Returns:
        Created provider instance.

      • requireNonNull

        default <T> T requireNonNull(T value)

        Checks a value if it is null or not. If it is not a null, this method returns the given value itself.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The given value.
        Returns:
        The value.

      • requireArgument

        default <T> T requireArgument(T value,
                              Predicate<? super T> cond)

        Checks a value if it meets a requirement specified by cond. If it does, the value itself will be returned.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be checked.
        cond - The requirement to check the value.
        Returns:
        The value.

      • requireState

        default <T> T requireState(T value,
                           Predicate<? super T> cond)

        Checks a value if it meets a requirement specified by cond. If it does, the value itself will be returned.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be checked.
        cond - The requirement to check the value.
        Returns:
        The value.

      • require

        default <T> T require(T value,
                      Predicate<? super T> cond)

        A method to check if a given value satisfies a precondition given as cond. If the cond is satisfied, the value itself will be returned. Otherwise, an exception returned by configuration().exceptionComposer().forRequire().exceptionForGeneralViolation(String) will be thrown.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - A value to be checked.
        cond - A condition to check if value satisfies.
        Returns:
        The value, if cond is satisfied.

      • require

        default <T> T require(T value,
                      Predicate<? super T> cond,
                      Function<String,Throwable> exceptionFactory)

        A method to check if a given value satisfies a precondition given as cond. If the cond is satisfied, the value itself will be returned. Otherwise, an exception created by exceptionFactory is thrown.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - A value to be checked.
        cond - A condition to check if value satisfies.
        exceptionFactory - A function to create an exception thrown when cond is not satisfied by value.
        Returns:
        The value, if cond is satisfied.

      • validate

        default <T> T validate(T value,
                       Predicate<? super T> cond,
                       ExceptionComposer.ForValidate forValidate)

        Validates the given value. If the value satisfies a condition cond, the value itself will be returned. Otherwise, an exception created by forValidate.exceptionForGeneralViolation() will be thrown. This method is intended to be used by Validates#validate(Object, Predicate, Function) method in valid8j library.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be checked.
        cond - A condition to validate the value.
        forValidate - An exception composer for "validate" methods.
        Returns:
        The value itself.

      • validateNonNull

        default <T> T validateNonNull(T value,
                              ExceptionComposer.ForValidate forValidate)

        Validates the given value. If the value is not null, the value itself will be returned. Otherwise, an exception created by forValidate.exceptionForGeneralViolation() will be thrown. This method is intended to be used by Validates#validateNonNull(Object) method in valid8j library.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be checked.
        forValidate - An exception composer for "validate" methods.
        Returns:
        The value itself.

      • validateArgument

        default <T> T validateArgument(T value,
                               Predicate<? super T> cond,
                               ExceptionComposer.ForValidate forValidate)

        Validates the given argument variable value. If the value satisfies a condition cond for checking an argument variable, the value itself will be returned. Otherwise, an exception created by forValidate.exceptionForIllegalArgument() will be thrown. This method is intended to be used by Validates#validateArgument(Object, Predicate) method in valid8j library.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be checked.
        cond - A condition to validate the value.
        forValidate - An exception composer for "validate" methods.
        Returns:
        The value itself.

      • validateState

        default <T> T validateState(T value,
                            Predicate<? super T> cond,
                            ExceptionComposer.ForValidate forValidate)

        Validates the given state variable value. If the value satisfies a condition cond for checking a state, the value itself will be returned. Otherwise, an exception created by forValidate.exceptionForIllegalState() will be thrown. This method is intended to be used by Validates#validateState(Object, Predicate) method in valid8j library.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be checked.
        cond - A condition to validate the value.
        forValidate - An exception composer for "validate" methods.
        Returns:
        The value itself.

      • validate

        default <T> T validate(T value,
                       Predicate<? super T> cond,
                       Function<String,Throwable> exceptionFactory)

        Validates the given variable value. If the value satisfies a condition cond, the value itself will be returned. Otherwise, an exception created by exceptionFactory will be thrown. This method is intended to be used by Validates#validate(Object, Predicate, Function) method in valid8j library.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be checked.
        cond - A condition to validate the value.
        exceptionFactory - A function to create an exception when the cond is not satisfied.
        Returns:
        The value itself.

      • validate_2

        default <T> T validate_2(T value,
                         Predicate<? super T> cond,
                         Validator.ExceptionFactory<Throwable> exceptionFactory)

      • ensureNonNull

        default <T> T ensureNonNull(T value)

        Checks a value if it is not null. If it is not null, the value itself will be returned. If it is, an exception created by configuration().exceptionComposer().forEnsure().exceptionForNonNullViolation() will be thrown. This method is intended for ensuring a "post-condition".

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be checked.
        Returns:
        The value.

      • ensureState

        default <T> T ensureState(T value,
                          Predicate<? super T> cond)

        Checks a value if it meets a requirement specified by cond. If it does, the value itself will be returned. If it does not, an exception created by configuration().exceptionComposer().forEnsure().exceptionForIllegalState() will be thrown. This method is intended for ensuring a "post-condition" of a state.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be checked.
        cond - The requirement to check the value.
        Returns:
        The value.

      • ensure

        default <T> T ensure(T value,
                     Predicate<? super T> cond)

        Checks a value if it meets a requirement specified by cond. If it does, the value itself will be returned. If it does not, an exception created by configuration().exceptionComposer().forEnsure().exceptionForGeneralViolation() will be thrown. This method is intended for ensuring a "post-condition".

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be checked.
        cond - The requirement to check the value.
        Returns:
        The value.

      • ensure

        default <T> T ensure(T value,
                     Predicate<? super T> cond,
                     Function<String,Throwable> exceptionComposer)

        Checks a value if it meets a requirement specified by cond. If it does, the value itself will be returned. If it does not, an exception created by exceptionComposer will be thrown. This method is intended for ensuring a "post-condition".

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be checked.
        cond - The requirement to check the value.
        exceptionComposer - A function to create an exception to be thrown when cond is not met.
        Returns:
        The value.

      • checkInvariant

        default <T> void checkInvariant(T value,
                                Predicate<? super T> cond)

        A method to check if a value satisfies a predicate cond.

        This method is intended to be used by Assertions#that(Object, Predicate) in valid8j library. If the condition is not satisfied, an exception created by this.exceptionComposer().forAssert().exceptionInvariantConditionViolation() method will be thrown.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of value.
        Parameters:
        value - A value to be checked.
        cond - A condition to check the value.

      • checkPrecondition

        default <T> void checkPrecondition(T value,
                                   Predicate<? super T> cond)

        A method to check if a value satisfies a predicate cond.

        This method is intended to be used by Assertions#precondition(Object, Predicate) in valid8j library. If the condition is not satisfied, an exception created by this.exceptionComposer().forAssert().exceptionPreconditionViolation() method will be thrown.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of value.
        Parameters:
        value - A value to be checked.
        cond - A condition to check the value.

      • checkPostcondition

        default <T> void checkPostcondition(T value,
                                    Predicate<? super T> cond)

        A method to check if a value satisfies a predicate cond.

        This method is intended to be used by Assertions#postcondition(Object, Predicate) in valid8j library. If the condition is not satisfied, an exception created by this.exceptionComposer().forAssert().exceptionPostconditionViolation() method will be thrown.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of value.
        Parameters:
        value - A value to be checked.
        cond - A condition to check the value.

      • assertThat

        default <T> void assertThat(T value,
                            Predicate<? super T> cond)

        Executes a test assertion for a given value using a predicate cond. If the cond is not satisfied by the value, an exception created by configuration().messageComposer().composeMessageForAssertion() will be thrown.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - A value to be checked.
        cond - A predicate to check a given value.

      • assumeThat

        default <T> void assumeThat(T value,
                            Predicate<? super T> cond)

        Executes a test assumption check for a given value using a predicate cond. If the cond is not satisfied by the value, an exception created by configuration().messageComposer().composeMessageForAssertion() will be thrown.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        value - A value to be checked.
        cond - A predicate to check a given value.

      • checkValueAndThrowIfFails

        default <T> T checkValueAndThrowIfFails(T value,
                                        Predicate<? super T> cond,
                                        BiFunction<T,Predicate<? super T>,String> messageComposerFunction,
                                        Validator.ExceptionFactory<Throwable> exceptionComposerFunction)

        The core method of the ValueChecker. This method checks if the given evaluationContext satisfies a condition, passed as cond. If it does, the evaluationContext itself will be returned. If not, an appropriate message will be composed based on the evaluationContext and cond by the messageComposerFunction. Internally in this method, an Explanation of the failure is created by a ReportComposer object returned by configuration().reportComposer() method. The Explanation is passed to the exceptionComposerFunction and the exception created by the function will be thrown.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the evaluationContext.
        Parameters:
        value - A value to be checked.
        cond - A predicate that checks the evaluationContext.
        messageComposerFunction - A function that composes an error message from the evaluationContext and the predicate cond.
        exceptionComposerFunction - A function that creates an exception from a failure report created inside this method.
        Returns:
        The evaluationContext itself.
